body: End of the comedy.Preface to the 1970 EditionAt the white place of the road's vanishingToward . . . that seems to be the whispered questionIn Florida, it's strawberry seasonShe stretches a hand toward the toothy sleeperWhiteness, those pediments that riseIX. After the Great Northern ExpeditionStars, the last day, endless and centerless,Against which we have been projected? What . . .As if your human shape were what the stormStunned in their voiceless way to be aliveAway from their profundity of surface.Bronze the sky, with noThinking of your abiding spirit bringsHow can they get the point of how a worldthe foul pole relaxes. She's raged all afternoonIs the moon to growWould their world not remain comfortably
